result.execSummary:
The defendant James J Hughes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, James J Hughes was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James J Hughes is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • James J Hughes was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court Reporter: Philip Harrelson
Courtroom without jury panel present; Court and counsel approved preliminary jury instructions and discussed pretrial matters; jury panel present; jurors sworn by clerk; preliminary instructions given by the Court; opening statements of counsel; State's evidence - testimony and exhibits; State rested; Defendant's evidence - testimony and exhibits; Court designated Juror 12 as the alternate juror after juror disclosed that he had overheard two of the State's witnesses discussing the case over the lunch hour; counsel did not object to the juror being excused and continuing the case; Defendant's case continued; Defendant rested; State's rebuttal evidence - testimony and exhibit; State rested; evidence closed; jury removed from courtroom; jury instruction conference on the record; jury panel present; Court gave final jury instructions; closing arguments by counsel; rebuttal argument by Atty Moeser; Court continued giving final jury instructions; bailiff sworn by clerk; jury removed for deliberations; jury returned to court with their verdict; Count 1 - guilty; Count 2 - not guilty; Court polled jurors; Court gave closing instructions and excused jurors; Atty Moeser moved for judgment on Count 1; Atty Knoll moved for judgment on Count 2; Court entered judgment of guilty on Count 1 and dismissal of Count 2 with prejudice; Court proceeded to sentencing; argument of counsel; Court imposed sentence; court adjourned

Reporter: Heather Kieta
Courtroom without prospective jurors present; Court ruled on State and Defendant's motions in limine; 21 jurors to be seated - 4 strikes each; prospective jurors present; introduction by the Court; jurors sworn by clerk; 21 prospective jurors chosen - Jurors 1 thru 21 seated; Court questioned jurors; Jurors 6, 16 and 12 excused for cause and replaced with Jurors 22, 23 and 24; voir dire by counsel; voir dire concluded; jurors not seated excused; strikes exercised by counsel - 4 strikes each; 13 jurors chosen for final panel; counsel had no Batson objections to peremptory challenges; jurors not chosen excused; Court admonished jurors and excused; impanelling concluded
